name: jQueryMessageBox
tagline: A jQuery plugin to create configurable status message boxes
body:
A simple jQuery plugin to show up configurable CSS3 compliant message boxes in a webpage.

Requires jQuery v1.4 or greater.

***
## Usage:
`$.jQueryMessageBox(options);`

options is a json object with properties like type, behavior, title, text etc.
options may include the following:

* type: The type of the message box. It can be displayed as a modal or as a banner.
possible values: modal,banner
* behavior: The status of the message. Message boxes for success, warning and error messages are distinguished by this poperty.
possible values: success,warning,error
* title: The title of the message.
* text: The message text.
* color: The font color of the displayed text.
* fontStyle: The font family to be applied to the text
* autoClose: If set to true, the message box will close after a specified duration.
* duration: The time in ms after which the message box will close automatically.
* showAfter: If set to true, the message box will be displayed after a specified delay.
* showAfterDuration: The delay in ms after which the message box will be displayed.
* location: The display location of the message box. The default location is top for banner and center for modal.
possible values: top,bottom,center, default

Eg.:
 
```

options = { type: 'modal',
              
             behavior: 'success',

             text : 'The settings have been saved successfully',

             title: 'Saved',

             fontStyle : 'Verdana',

             autoClose	: true,

             duration	: 5000};

```
